description: We describe a chemical-genetic approach for inducible silencing of Caenorhabditis elegans neurons in intact animals, using the histamine-gated chloride channel HisCl1 from Drosophila and exogenous histamine. Administering histamine to freely moving C. elegans that express HisCl1 transgenes in neurons leads to rapid and potent inhibition of neural activity within minutes. C. elegans does not use histamine as an endogenous neurotransmitter, and exogenous histamine has little apparent effect on wild-type C. elegans behavior.

materials.reagent_sku: Per Pokala et al 2014, request p

protocol_affiliation: New York Institute of Technology,Rockefeller University
manuscript_citation: Inducible and titratable silencing of Caenorhabditis elegans neurons in vivo with histamine-gated chloride channels
guidelines: Gloves are recommended while making or handling histamine-containing liquids. Avoid contact with eyes and skin.
status_info: We use this protocol for working with the histamine-HisCl1 system in C elegans

components.data: Put on gloves. Gloves are recommended while making or handling histamine-containing liquids. Avoid contact with eyes and skin.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Put on gloves. Gloves are recommended while making or handling histamine-containing liquids. Avoid contact with eyes and skin.

components.data: Histamine media
components.name: Section

components.data: Histamine media
components.name: Section

components.data:
Make NGM-HA and NGM control agar.

In a 2L flask, add:

17g agar

2.5g peptone

3g NaCl

975mL water + stirbar

Autoclave (liquid mode, 121˚C for 1hr).

Also autoclave a empty 1L flask with a stirbar inside.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

In a 2L flask, add:

17g agar

2.5g peptone

3g NaCl

975mL water + stirbar

Autoclave (liquid mode, 121˚C for 1hr).

Also autoclave a empty 1L flask with a stirbar inside.

components.data: Histamine media
components.name: Section

components.data: Make 1M histamine (HA) stock - Dissolve 1.85g histamine dihydrochloride (Sigma-Aldrich H7250) per 10mL water. Sterile filter and store at -20˚C until use.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Make 1M histamine (HA) stock - Dissolve 1.85g histamine dihydrochloride (Sigma-Aldrich H7250) per 10mL water. Sterile filter and store at -20˚C until use.

components.data: Histamine media
components.name: Section

components.data: Place both flasks on heated stirplates at 60˚C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place both flasks on heated stirplates at 60˚C.

components.data: Histamine media
components.name: Section

components.data:
When the 2L flask is cool enough to hold comfortably with a gloved hand (~60˚C), add while stirring:

1mL cholesterol (5mg/mL in ethanol)

1mL 1M CaCl2

1mL 1M MgSO4

25mL 1M potassium phosphate pH 6.0
components.name: Description

25mL 1M potassium phosphate pH 6.0

components.data: Histamine media
components.name: Section

components.data: Using 50mL pipettes, sterilely transfer 500mL molten NGM agar to the 1L flask.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using 50mL pipettes, sterilely transfer 500mL molten NGM agar to the 1L flask.

components.data: Histamine media
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 5mL 1M HA stock to the 1L flask while stirring to make NGM-HA agar with 10mM histamine. The strength of neural inhibition can be titrated, with 1mM giving intermediate effects, and 10mM giving maximal effects.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 5mL 1M HA stock to the 1L flask while stirring to make NGM-HA agar with 10mM histamine. The strength of neural inhibition can be titrated, with 1mM giving intermediate effects, and 10mM giving maximal effects.

components.data: Histamine media
components.name: Section

components.data: Pour control agar (from the 2L flask) and NGM-HA agar (from the 1L flask) into labeled petri dishes. 10mL for small (35mm), 25mL for large (100mm) dishes. NGM-HA plates stored at 4˚C retained their potency for at least 2 months.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pour control agar (from the 2L flask) and NGM-HA agar (from the 1L flask) into labeled petri dishes. 10mL for small (35mm), 25mL for large (100mm) dishes. NGM-HA plates stored at 4˚C retained their potency for at least 2 months.

components.data: The day before the experiment, pick 20-60 array-containing L4 animals.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The day before the experiment, pick 20-60 array-containing L4 animals.

components.data: Example experiment - anterior touch
components.name: Section

components.data:
If necessary, attach a hair to a P200 pipette tip:

            Pluck or cut an eyelash or a hair from the back of your finger.

            Place the tip of a P200 tip far above a flame until there is a bit of molten plastic.

            Using forceps, quickly anchor one end of the hair into the molten plastic.

            Wipe the hair with a Kimwipe soaked in ethanol. Use a second P200 tip as a sheath for storage.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
If necessary, attach a hair to a P200 pipette tip:

            Using forceps, quickly anchor one end of the hair into the molten plastic.

            Wipe the hair with a Kimwipe soaked in ethanol. Use a second P200 tip as a sheath for storage.

components.data: Example experiment - anterior touch
components.name: Section

components.data: Take histamine and control plates from 4˚C storage and store at room temperature overnight.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Take histamine and control plates from 4˚C storage and store at room temperature overnight.

components.data: Example experiment - anterior touch
components.name: Section

components.data: The day of the experiment, dry the plates without the lids for 1hr. Dry an additional food-free NGM plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The day of the experiment, dry the plates without the lids for 1hr. Dry an additional food-free NGM plate.

components.data: Example experiment - anterior touch
components.name: Section

components.data: Pick young adult worms to the food-free NGM plate. Let the animals crawl away from any carried-over food.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pick young adult worms to the food-free NGM plate. Let the animals crawl away from any carried-over food.

components.data: Example experiment - anterior touch
components.name: Section

components.data: Gently pick 10 animals to each control plate, and 10 animals to each histamine plate. Histamine takes effect within one or two minutes. After removal from histamine, animals can take one to two hours for full recovery.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Gently pick 10 animals to each control plate, and 10 animals to each histamine plate. Histamine takes effect within one or two minutes. After removal from histamine, animals can take one to two hours for full recovery.

components.data: Example experiment - anterior touch
components.name: Section

components.data: Blind the plates: Remove any markings on the plate. Designate a one-character code for each strain and condition and write it on a thin piece of tape. Place the tape on the side of the plate, and cover the tape with another piece of tape. Shuffle the plates and leave undisturbed with the lid off for 30min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Blind the plates: Remove any markings on the plate. Designate a one-character code for each strain and condition and write it on a thin piece of tape. Place the tape on the side of the plate, and cover the tape with another piece of tape. Shuffle the plates and leave undisturbed with the lid off for 30min.

components.data: Example experiment - anterior touch
components.name: Section

components.data: After 30min, assay animals on each plate by gently stroking the area just posterior to the pharynx with the eyelash. Record the reversal length (number of body bends or head swings), and whether the animal performs an omega turn (sharp turn >135˚ or head touching the ventral surface). Animals that make a reversal less than a body bend are scored as 0.5. Also record if an animal pauses instead of performing a reversal; these animals are scored as having a reversal length of 0, but positive for a response.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After 30min, assay animals on each plate by gently stroking the area just posterior to the pharynx with the eyelash. Record the reversal length (number of body bends or head swings), and whether the animal performs an omega turn (sharp turn >135˚ or head touching the ventral surface). Animals that make a reversal less than a body bend are scored as 0.5. Also record if an animal pauses instead of performing a reversal; these animals are scored as having a reversal length of 0, but positive for a response.

components.data: Example experiment - anterior touch
components.name: Section

components.data: After completion of assays, wipe the hair with an ethanol-soaked Kimwipe and re-sheath for use on another day.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After completion of assays, wipe the hair with an ethanol-soaked Kimwipe and re-sheath for use on another day.

components.data: Example experiment - anterior touch
components.name: Section

components.data: Un-blind the plates by removing the covering tape.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Un-blind the plates by removing the covering tape.

components.data: Example experiment - anterior touch
components.name: Section

components.data: Calculate the mean reversal length, fraction of animals that perform an omega turn, and fraction of animals that have any response, including a pause.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Calculate the mean reversal length, fraction of animals that perform an omega turn, and fraction of animals that have any response, including a pause.

components.data: Example experiment - anterior touch
components.name: Section

components.data: Histamine media
components.name: Section

components.data: While the pH of standard NGM media does not change appreciably upon the addition of 10mM histamine dihydrochloride, it is strongly recommended that the pH of less strongly buffered solutions and media be checked and adjusted as needed (with control plates modified in tandem).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: While the pH of standard NGM media does not change appreciably upon the addition of 10mM histamine dihydrochloride, it is strongly recommended that the pH of less strongly buffered solutions and media be checked and adjusted as needed (with control plates modified in tandem).
